title: Unclear error message when calling a model with a tensor instead of variable
body_html:
>>> dataiter = iter(dataloader)
>>> inputs, labels = dataiter.next()
>>> model(inputs)
RuntimeError: save_for_backward can only save input or output tensors, but argument 0 doesn't satisfy this condition
>>> model(Variable(inputs))
>>> # No error

Would it be possible to make the error message more explicit? Something like ValueError: Module instance can only be called with a Variable, not a Tensor..

Thanks!

body:
```python
>>> dataiter = iter(dataloader)
>>> inputs, labels = dataiter.next()
>>> model(inputs)
RuntimeError: save_for_backward can only save input or output tensors, but argument 0 doesn't satisfy this condition
>>> model(Variable(inputs))
>>> # No error
```

Would it be possible to make the error message more explicit? Something like `ValueError: Module instance can only be called with a Variable, not a Tensor.`.

Thanks!
